advertising.title: ACCOUNT DIRECTOR
advertising.description: My overall responsibility was strategic management of client relationships for GlaxoSmithKline brand portfolio (Voltaren, Panadol, Otrivin, Polident, Lamisil, Paradontax) ensuring Hogarth is delivering high value and agile workflow for any given project, as well as identifying and capitalising on new opportunities. More specifically:
tasks: Lead creative production and content management capability, overseeing 300-1.2MM advertising budgets and a 6 people team of Account and Project Managers.
Design and implement Digital Asset Management workflow transformation across partner agencies and Hogarth’s key APAC & EMEA hubs.
Support Business Director in commercial value proposition development.
Drive creative asset optimization solutions for multi-device/channel mix.

advertising.title: SENIOR ACCOUNT MANAGER
advertising.description: Part of Mastercard EMEA coordination hub, I provided ongoing assistance to the Head of Consumer Marketing & Sponsorships Europe in improving all local ATL advertising and sponsorship communications. With a team of strategists, creatives and account handlers we developed strategic guidelines for integrated 360° global brand campaign rollouts and reported on campaign performance measuring against benchmark KPIs. Key responsibilities:
tasks: Lead UEFA Madrid Final sponsorship toolkit - delivered assets including TV idents we shot in Barcelona, multiple cut-downs for Facebook and Instagram, over 80 DOOH and OOH formats including bespoke building & bus wraps, multiple display banners, print ads. 250k budget oversight.
Lead social media channel research and competitive analysis across EMEA markets, resulting in restructured and more centralised client-agency workflow.
Consult 32 EMEA markets (both client & agency) in local campaign development, ensuring best-of-breed creative and social capabilities across the network. Focusing mostly on digital effort.

Support local markets in developing one-of-a-kind PR stunts and secure regional client buy-in for bringing the project to life. The most notable success was Fingerprints billboards - EMEA creatives’ idea that I sold for Czech client.
Assure consistency of planning, measuring and reporting across markets.
Collaborate with media agency Carat and sponsorships agency Octagon in regional campaign planning and delivery, holding weekly updates.

advertising.title: ACCOUNT MANAGER
advertising.description: The year I joined McCann Bucharest, it was voted the most creative local McCann agency in the network – and I soon got to see why. Hired to be part of Mastercard CEE coordination hub, I learned the subtleties of relationship management within a complex organisational matrixes, and got to push creative limits internally working with wonderful and dedicated colleagues. I was invited to join the EMEA team I was reporting into after one year.
tasks: Work with Strategy, Creative, Digital and Production teams on local creative advertising campaigns. Direct responsibility for World Food Programme sponsorship asset development.
Enforce brand guidelines for B2C and B2B2C ATL campaigns in 16 CEE markets through weekly calls and annual summits.
First point of contact for clients & local agencies for all marketing-related questions.

advertising.title: MARKETING MANAGER
advertising.description: Scanorama’s Managing Director invited me to join the team with a specific task in mind: to help reposition the 2nd biggest film festival in Lithuania from Scandinavian to European film event, trying to expand its target audience and increase ticket sales. We achieved this by rebranding: upgrading style & design guidelines. Key responsibilities:
tasks: Collaborate with design agency on logo upgrade, new design guidelines, all festival’s advertising attributes (print & OOH posters, catalogues, guest passes etc.)
Collaborate with animation studio on 15’’ brand ident TV commercial.
Oversee 3rd party web & app developers and their UX teams to redesign festival’s website and app – simplified navigation resulted in 13% traffic increase YoY.

awareness.title: CAMP BUTTRESS
awareness.description:
Funded by European Youth Foundation and aimed at young independent musicians from Lithuania and Iceland, this women-only collaborative initiative brought 10 participants of diverse disciplines and backgrounds together for two workshop retreats. We created a safe space to share, experiment, fail, explore.

Each retreat culminated with a free concert for the local community. At Buttress Pape, we even surprised ourselves by making an impromptu single-take music video for one of the camp’s original songs ‘Again and Again’.

awareness.title: EXPERIMENT TRANSLATION
awareness.description:
When Lithuanian Centre for Human Rights asked us to help fight racial and homophobic hate speech online and in mass media, we knew we needed to deliver a communications campaign that can be impactful on a personal level.

Social Experiment TRANSLATION was shot with real people, unsuspecting they were being filmed and capturing their reactions faced with racism in a real-life situation.

We knew we hit the empathy strings hard when the video went viral the next day, reaching 4,300,000+ viewers on YouTube on its first week with zero media budget (yes, this was still possible back in 2015!)

The project won Silver at Golden Drum advertising festival in Slovenia, and was picked up by national and international mass media, including THE INDEPENDENT, DER SPIEGEL, AL JAZEERA, ZDF, TV GLOBO INTERNATIONAL, SBS, REDDIT, WHAT’S TRENDING, UPWORTHY, 9GAG, etc.

awareness.title: EVERY PIXEL COUNTS
awareness.description:
Commissioned by Lithuanian Neighbouring Rights Association, I partnered with Scanorama film festival to deliver an interactive anti-piracy communications campaign.

We designed a bespoke art piece to be brought to life by the festival goers themselves, turning passive film viewers into participants and blending education with entertainment.

awareness.title: MII4II
awareness.description: Collaborated with Comma8 modern dance choreographer Ruta Butkus on her intimate contemporary dance performance MII4II by hiring creative talent, organizing, advertising.

production.title: EXECUTIVE PRODUCER
production.description:
After earning a Film Bachelor at Queen Mary University of London in 2012, my life was all about shoots for a good while. I freelanced in various assistant & executive roles in film production, collaborated with local production houses on managing their projects, and eventually opened my own production studio in Vilnius to service creative agencies in making advertising content.

This first-hand experience of end-to-end creative development taught me the ins and outs of how high-end audiovisual content gets made and what it truly takes in terms of time, effort and costs – something that was fundamental in my future advertising & marketing roles.
